WorkItem.Description:
This is a very small request. As they are, PRISM assemblies cannot be used by applications running in a partial trust security zone. For instance, my team is interested in using PRISM in an XBAP application (without full trust). Adding the following to Assembly.cs in PRISM projects does the trick: 
[assembly: AllowPartiallyTrustedCallers]
Â 
Is this desirable? Or do you have other suggestions? What is your opinion about using PRISM in XBAP applications (non-Silverligtht)?
WorkItem.Summary: Partially Trusted Callers cannot use PRISM assemblies

Comments.Message:
I've added this assembly attribute and using PRISM, but then there is a problem with weak subscriptions:

Hi,
You might find the following blog posts useful to find a possible way to use Prism with XBAP applications:
Migrating Composite Application Guidance (Prism-v2) to XBAP (http://blogs.southworks.net/matiasb/2009/03/11/using-cal-with-xbap-applications/)

Composite Application Guidance for WPF & Silverlight (Prism v2) Reference Implementation migrated to XBap (http://blogs.southworks.net/dschenkelman/2009/03/13/composite-application-guidance-for-wpf-silverlight-prism-v2-reference-implementation-migrated-to-xbap/).

I hope you find this information useful.

Thanks,

Miguel Bronzovic
http://blogs.southworks.net/mbronzovic

Hi,

Adding the AllowPartiallyTrustedCallers attribute to the assembly seems to be a valid possibility to achieve your scenario. I'm leaving this work item open as a suggestion so that the Prism team considers the subject of partial trust on future releases.

Thanks,

Guido Leandro Maliandi
http://blogs.southworks.net/gmaliandi
